intro: Mimozyganthus carinatus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Mimozyganthus carinatus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in both garden settings and as a cut flower.
